For issues, I attempt to look at the party, rather than the individual, in terms of position on particular issues. I don't think it's in a candidates best interest to ever tell the truth for thruth's sake, so I can't really rely on what they say. Nor can we rely on the political hype, it's just a song and dance...getting elected is their only goal.
 
 However, I DO look at the individual candidate for leadership, generally supported by charisma, and intelligence. I think leadership combines both charisma and intelligence, wielded together in a way that motivates and inspires.
 
 Independant, rational thinker. No, not making decisions in a vaccum, just capable of making a decision based on other's inputs, not just "What the party wants them to do".
 
 In these ways I think Reagan, and Clinton, where both good leaders, Reagan maybe highest on charisma, Clinton higher on intelligence, but both effective leaders. Clinton ruined much of is charisma with his infidelity during office, that was just sad...it also puts in question his willpower/intelligence to some degree.
 
 Dukakis didn't inspire me, and neither did Dole. Gore could have, had he been more personable, but he never broke the ice. Kerry sort of inspires me, just because he's a political fanatic, he's been debating serious issues...intelligently, since his teens. But place him next to Bush, and he's magnificent :/
 
 Bush, I just cannot stand listenting to him or seeing him. He seems tragically ignorant and incapable of communicating in anything less than a robotic, oddly punctuated manner. And I think he's neither an independant thinker, nor very intelligent. He doesn't read much, and he works 9-5 and hangs out on the ranch all the time. As a business owner, I have worked 12+ hours a day, and weekends, since I started, and that's LIGHT for a business owner..my mentors all worked more than me...for 5+ years in some cases. 
 Yet someone who gets the chance to steer the helm of the greatest nation on earth can't put in some GD overtime or read to expand his knowledge? He has some physical charisma, but that's about it, the rest does nothing to inspire me.
 
 I am very moderate, and don't think either party is ever all encompasing right or the best just because they are party X. I realize to get what I want out of this country it's likely that I'll need a cyclic presidency of democrat, followed by republican, democrat, republican, etc...maybe mix in senate seats etc. to even it out however it falls during the election year. However, I DO think I can benefit, and the country as a whole, when either party is in office, when the person in charge is a great leader.
 
 So what do you look for in a leader/president? How do recent candidates stack up?
